item.title: Huawei executive Meng Wanzhou freed by Canada arrives home in China
item.description: Two Canadians detained by China are also freed, bringing to an end a three-year diplomatic row.

item.title: Germany elections: Merkel backs 'bridge-builder' Laschet as successor
item.description: The outgoing leader strongly endorses her party's candidate Armin Laschet in an unusually tight poll race.

item.title: Afghanistan: Taliban hang bodies as warning in city of Herat, say reports
item.description: The alleged kidnappers are reportedly hung in public, a day after a warning executions would resume.

item.title: Afghanistan: Inside the prison staffed by former inmates released by the Taliban
item.description: The BBC's Jeremy Bowen goes inside Kabul's main jail, where former Taliban inmates are now caretakers.

item.title: Somalia: Seven killed in suicide attack near presidential palace
item.description: The Islamist militant group Al-Shabab has claimed responsibility for the attack in Mogadishu.

item.title: Canary Islands: Firefighters retreat as volcano intensifies
item.description: Hundreds of homes have been destroyed and thousands displaced since the volcano erupted on Sunday.

item.title: Music company buys NFT of 'Side-eyeing Chloe' meme
item.description: The image of two-year-old Chloe Clem making a disapproving face was auctioned in cryptocurrency.

item.title: One of NYC's poshest buildings facing $250m lawsuit over building defects
item.description: A posh building on NYC's Billionaire Row has been facing a series of serious woes.

item.title: R. Kelly trial: A look at the key moments as jury deliberates
item.description: The five-week trial heard harrowing details of abuse and assault. Here are the key moments.

item.title: Jitender Maan Gogi: India gangster shot dead in Delhi court
item.description: Two men dressed as lawyers opened fire in court on a man police detained on charges of murder and extortion.

item.title: Attacked by a hyena: My advice for a fellow victim
item.description: Nine-year-old Rodwell Nkomazana lost an eye, his nose, and his upper lip when he was mauled by a hyena.

item.title: Actor Michael K Williams died of accidental drug overdose, coroner confirms
item.description: The actor died after overdosing on a combination of fentanyl, p-fluorofentanyl, heroin and cocaine.

item.title: Quad countries vow to work for freedom in region
item.description: The leaders of the US, Japan, India and Australia also launched a new climate initiative at the US summit.

item.title: Kenyan policeman wakes up from coma to find he was sacked
item.description: Neither his family nor the police force could locate Reuben Kimutai Lel, who was actually in hospital.

item.title: Meng Wanzhou: The PowerPoint that sparked an international row
item.description: After three years, Huawei's chief financial officer has a US extradition request against her dropped.

item.title: La Palma volcano: Visual guide to what happened
item.description: A series of maps and charts explaining what happened after an eruption in the Spanish Canary Islands.

item.title: Climate change: Whisper it cautiously... there's been progress in run up to COP26
item.description: Pledges made at the UN have lifted hopes for the Glasgow summit, but some major questions remain.

item.title: Sustainable fashion: From the red carpet to our wardrobes?
item.description: Hannah Peel wore a sustainable dress to the Mercury Awards - but is the fashion industry changing?

item.title: Gambia's Jammeh pact bombshell: Treachery or reconciliation?
item.description: A political pact that could see the return of Gambia's exiled ex-President Jammeh proves divisive.

item.title: Haitian migrants at US border: 'We've been through 11 countries'
item.description: Fiterson's hellish seven-year journey through 11 countries explains migrants' desperation at US border.

item.title: Gabby Petito case: The missing Americans you don't hear about
item.description: Keen public interest in the Gabby Petito case has renewed the urgency of other missing person cases.

item.title: Ros Atkins On… Germany’s election explained
item.description: Ros Atkins explains how Germany’s election works, the candidates and the issues at stake.

item.title: Switzerland to hold referendum on same-sex marriage
item.description: Voters in Switzerland go to the polls this Sunday to decide whether to allow same-sex marriage.

item.title: Migrants freezing to death on Belarus-Poland border
item.description: The BBC finds stranded migrants facing sub-zero temperatures amid a row between Poland and Belarus.

item.title: Thousands remain at Haitian migrant camp in Texas
item.description: Local officials have struggled to provide food and sanitation to the Haitian migrants.

item.title: Angela Merkel: What will Germans miss about the chancellor?
item.description: BBC Europe editor Katya Adler takes a road trip to find out how Germans will remember their chancellor.

item.title: German elections 2021: Simple guide to vote ending Merkel era
item.description: Germans are choosing a new government on Sunday. This is how the vote works.

item.title: Angela Merkel: A career in pictures
item.description: As Angela Merkel steps down as German chancellor, we take a look back at the photos documenting her career.

item.title: German election: Who could succeed Angela Merkel as chancellor?
item.description: A lacklustre lead candidate and a surprisingly strong Social Democrat have blown the race wide open.

item.title: German elections 2021: 'Bazooka man' Olaf Scholz bidding for chancellor
item.description: The centre-left finance minister has led the polls in the run-up to the vote to succeed Angela Merkel.

item.title: German elections: How Angela Merkel changed her country
item.description: Young people have never known another leader, and many worry for the future as old certainties shift.
